simulation package¶

Submodules¶

simulation.behaviors module¶

simulation.behaviors.drop_food(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior that causes an agent to drop food. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.behaviors.move_east(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior that causes an agent to move east one unit. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.behaviors.move_north(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior that causes an agent to move north one unit. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.behaviors.move_south(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior that causes an agent to move south one unit. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.behaviors.move_west(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior that causes an agent to move west one unit. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.behaviors.pickup_food(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior that causes an agent to pickup food. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.behaviors.random_walk(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior that causes an agent to walk in a random direction for one time step. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.behaviors.return_home(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Behavior (naive) that causes an agent to return to the nest. :param agent: The agent to perform the behavior. :param entities: A list of entities in the simulation. :param environment: The environment containing the agent. :return: The updated agent.

simulation.entity module¶

class simulation.entity.Entity(position=(0, 0), size=(1, 1), direction=<Direction.North: (0, )>)¶

Bases: object

A standard representation of an entity. All entities have the following attributes; a unique ID, a two-dimensional body on a two-dimensional grid, a direction indicating the orientiation of the entity, a behavior indicating the current behavior the entity is performing, a time counter used for managing simulation time, an inventory that can contain other entities, and a boolean indicating whether or not the entity is interactable.

eid = <method-wrapper 'next' of itertools.count object>¶
to_csv()¶

Returns a list of various entity attributes, to be used in a CSV file.

simulation.environment module¶

class simulation.environment.Environment(position=(0, 20), size=(20, 20))¶

An environment is simply a large two-dimensional body that is used by the simulator to determine the boundries where agents can reside.

simulation.lookup module¶

simulation.preconditions module¶

simulation.preconditions.holding_food(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Precondition testing if an agent is holding food. :param agent: The agent to test. :param entities: The entities associated with the simulation. :param environment: The environment to test against. :return: Boolean value indicating the result of the test.

simulation.preconditions.on_border(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Precondition testing if an agent is along the border of the environment. :param agent: The agent to test. :param entities: The entities associated with the simulation. :param environment: The environment to test against. :return: Boolean value indicating the result of the test.

simulation.preconditions.on_food(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Precondition testing if an agent is on top of food. :param agent: The agent to test. :param entities: The entities associated with the simulation. :param environment: The environment to test against. :return: Boolean value indicating the result of the test.

simulation.preconditions.on_nest(agent=None, entities=None, environment=None)¶

Precondition testing if an agent is on top of the nest. :param agent: The agent to test. :param entities: The entities associated with the simulation. :param environment: The environment to test against. :return: Boolean value indicating the result of the test.

simulation.simulation module¶

class simulation.simulation.Simulation(duration=500, environment=None, entities=None, parse_tree=None, produce_output=True)¶

A simple simulator designed to be used with GESwarm (Grammatical Evolution Swarm). Parse trees containing a set of rules dictate the control flow of the simulation. Rules contain a list of preconditions, behaviors, and actions. Together these rules may lead to interesting behaviors.

For more information about GESwarm, see the article (http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=2463385).

execute()¶

Executes the simulation, updating entities and saving their states at each time step.

process_rules(agent)¶

Processes the rule set on a given entity. :param agent: The agent to evaluate with the rule set. :return: The entity, with possible updates.

save_state(entity=None)¶

Saves the current state of all entities to the state archive. :param entity: The entity to add to the state archive

simulation.utils module¶

class simulation.utils.Direction¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Cardinal directions used to represent the orientation of entities on a 2D grid.

East = <Direction.East: (1,)>¶
North = <Direction.North: (0,)>¶
South = <Direction.South: (2,)>¶
West = <Direction.West: 3>¶
class simulation.utils.Point(x=None, y=None)¶

A point identified by (x, y) coordinates.

as_tuple()¶

Returns a tuple representation of the point.

clone()¶

Clones the point, creating a new point at the same position.

distance_to(point)¶

Calculates the distance from the given point to the current point. :param point: The point to compare to.

floatize()¶

Converts the position to float values.

integerize()¶

Converts the position to integer values.

length()¶

Calculates the distance from the origin to the current point.

move(position=None)¶

Moves the point to a new position. :param position: The new position of the point.

shift(delta=None)¶

Shifts a point by some delta. :param delta: The amount in each direction to shift the point. Must be a list or tuple.

class simulation.utils.Rectangle(top_left=None, bottom_right=None)¶

A rectangle identified by two points (top-left and bottom-right).

Coordinates are based on the Cartesian coordinate system.

y+ top top-left (x, y) +————-+ ^ | | | | left -+- right | | + - - - > x+ | | | origin bottom +————-+ bottom-right (x, y)

contains_point(point)¶

Returns a boolean indicating if the given point is contained in the rectangle. :param point: The point to compare against the current rectangle.

contains_rectangle(rectangle)¶

Returns a boolean indicating if the given rectangle is contained in the current rectangle. :param rectangle: The rectangle to compare agianst the current rectangle.

contract(amount=1)¶

Contracts the bounds of the rectangle in all directions. :param amount: The amount of units to contract.

expand(amount=1)¶

Expands the bounds of the rectangle in all directions. :param amount: The amount of units to expand.

set_points(top_left=None, bottom_right=None)¶

Resets the rectangle coordinates. :param top_left: The new top-left point to assign to the rectangle. :param bottom_right: The new bottom-right point to assign to the rectangle.

simulation.utils.generate_csv(simulation=None)¶

Generates a CSV file from a simulation for further data analysis. :param simulation: The simulation containing a valid state archive.

simulation.utils.generate_mongo(simulation=None, host='localhost', port=27017)¶

Adds a simulation to a MongoDB instance for further data analysis. :param simulation: The simulation containing a valid state archive. :param host: The host to reach the MongoDB instance. :param port: The port to reach the MongoDB instance.
